TopicTitle: Tiger-II "King Tiger" Panzerkampfwagen Tiger Ausf. B

Articles.Content:
It's here!

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Da_1vTCTJL8?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Utqsnjwx5LI?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

With the commander's cupola, new reinforced mechanical bearing, 2nd generation suspension system, reinforced road wheels, and side mounted turret SD's, it'll crush the puny British and American firefly tanks that dare delay its journey.

At about 50 tons, it falls short of the Tiger II's 70 ton weight, but I'll fix that shortcoming with my upcoming Jadtiger. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

[https://www.dropbox.com/s/llhdic8y5ftkfai/Tiger-IIA.craft?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/llhdic8y5ftkfai/Tiger-IIA.craft?dl=0)

If the bearing seems to get stuck, just pull up a bit or wiggle around, and it'll work fine. Otherwise, it's a really advanced tank, with an intricate internal structure and excellent suspension system. It can drive better than my medium tanks.

![yPo9yie.png](http://i.imgur.com/yPo9yie.png)

![quPcWsd.png](http://i.imgur.com/quPcWsd.png)

![JjV0TNb.png](http://i.imgur.com/JjV0TNb.png)

![HmKUSYf.png](http://i.imgur.com/HmKUSYf.png)

Instantaneous braking. 20 m/s to 0 m/s in 1 second.

![Eh3KUnx.png](http://i.imgur.com/Eh3KUnx.png)

![YTtN3tZ.png](http://i.imgur.com/YTtN3tZ.png)

![LMWWGML.png](http://i.imgur.com/LMWWGML.png)

![9EPRHfp.png](http://i.imgur.com/9EPRHfp.png)

And look out for the Jadtiger, coming to a liberated capital near you!! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

It looks good, you're certainly improving.

However, I would like to see a little less anime in the OP, please!

Amazing as always, andrew! Good work. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

The realism!

I have the new official song of my armored corps.

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/1mG3BvkT6YQ?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

And I'm making a T-72A right now. Have to get to detailing some aspects, and I might add the dolly parton composite armor.
